alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 1:08PM MST until December 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...POTENT WINTER STORM CONTINUES... .A strong winter storm will continue to impact the region through tonight. Additional snow amounts will generally be highest across the northern Black Hills area, and southwest through south central South Dakota. Strong northwest winds gusting 35 to 50 mph at times on the South Dakota plains will continue to support blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times. Listen to NOAA Weather Radio or your local media for the latest updates on this storm. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, with the higher totals mainly north of I-90. An additional 4 to 9 inches possible in the Bear Lodge Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County, Southern Campbell County, Western Crook County, the Wyoming Black Hills and the Weston County Plains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills
